intro: Hieracium pegophyton, commonly known as the purple meadowhawk, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are purple or pink, often with yellow centers. It is an annual or biennial plant, depending on the climate, and plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
